it.polimi.se2018.server.network.socket

Class VirtualSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • it.polimi.se2018.server.network.VirtualView
        • it.polimi.se2018.server.network.socket.VirtualSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer

    public class VirtualSocket
extends VirtualView
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class VirtualSocket: the class is a subclass of the Virtual View, so it implements the same features, but it's responsible to effectively manage the communication with the socket technology. The class runs a thread to read the object sent from the client that use a socket connection and send the event to the controller to notify it.
    Author:
    fadda-miceli-mundo
    See Also:
    VirtualView, Runnable

      Server getServer()
      method that provide to the caller the current Server where the virtual socket is running

      method that provide to the caller the current state of the virtual socket
      void run()
      Override of the method run to start a virtual socket thread.
      void sendEvent(Event event)
      Override of the method of the superclass, the method is responsible to send the object of the event obtained as parameter and send it to socket handler of the client
      private void stopConnection()
      method that's responsible of closing the connection of the virtual socket with the socket handler of the client and update its state to not running anymore
      void update(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object arg)
      Override of the built-in method of the Observer class, it's called after a notify of the model, so that the virtual socket can update after a modification of the model and send to the client with the right method (Observer)

      • getServer

        public Server getServer()
        method that provide to the caller the current Server where the virtual socket is running
        Returns:
        the Server

      • run

        public void run()
        Override of the method run to start a virtual socket thread. The method is responsible to receive the event from the socket handler of the client, read the object associated with them and send the notification to the controller, the method also understand when a client disconnect and reconnect (Observable)
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendEvent

        public void sendEvent(Event event)
        Override of the method of the superclass, the method is responsible to send the object of the event obtained as parameter and send it to socket handler of the client
        Specified by:
        sendEvent in class VirtualView
        Parameters:
        event - to send to the client

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Override of the built-in method of the Observer class, it's called after a notify of the model, so that the virtual socket can update after a modification of the model and send to the client with the right method (Observer)
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - the observable
        arg - the object of the update
